item.title: Buffered reader help
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“wicked destiny, post:26, topic:254965”]Information:Compilation completed with 1 error and 1 warning Information:1 error Information:1 warning C:\Users\Sere\Desktop\Serenity\src\TownCache.java Warning:Warning:line (20)[deprecation] readLine() in java.io.DataInputStream has been deprecated Error:Error:line (26)non-static variable this cannot be referenced from a static context

this is the error

this is line 26: Town t = new Town(m.group(2), new Point(Integer.parseInt(m.group(3)), Integer.parseInt(m.group(4))),
this is line 27: m.group(6), Integer.parseInt(m.group(8)), Boolean.valueOf(m.group(10)).booleanValue(),
this is line 28: Boolean.valueOf(m.group(12)).booleanValue());[/quote]

It is saying that error because you cannot access variable ‘this’ in a static context because this is for virtual calls. You are automatically using ‘this’ to reference to nested class Town, as nested classes work similarly to variables in this case. If you were calling Test inside of a virtual method instead of a static method, you would have no problems. But because you wish to use the nested class in a static context, you must also make that nested class static.

Read full topic

item.title: Buffered reader help
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“wicked destiny, post:23, topic:254965”][quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=336908.msg2619604#msg2619604 date=1231283677]

[quote author=wicked destiny link=topic=336908.msg2618932#msg2618932 date=1231226105]

[quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=336908.msg2618261#msg2618261 date=1231190745]

hell no im not in to private servers anymore.
[/quote]You’re making an application… For private servers.

Would you happen to be from moparscape?

                        Rplayer = longToString(Long.parseLong(token2));

[/quote]Yes, he is. Especially because it’s the exact same reading method used in private servers today. Big clues: ReadMode and the [] tags in those shitty *.cfg files.

P.S. Have you even looked at my last post on this thread? Or did you skip it because it was too complex?

its not an application for private servers its for a total other thing…

and yes ive looked at it and im trying to figure out how to use it.
but it seems it wont work properly do the difference in static and non static.
do you know how i can read it from a textfield?
using P2.getselecteditem() this cannot be recalled due the fact its non static if i change it to static the other fiels wont work.
and yes te reading where from the p servers… but im changing it to my likings

and yes indeed its for travian.com …
[/quote]I don’t understand anything you just told me.

oke,

this form im working on isn’t an application for private servers
instead it’s a programm that calulates travel time to certain point for hostile takeover a town.

ive looked at the piece of code you provided and it seems that it wont work properly due the fact it has a non static piece in a static code.
thats the error im getting.

the piece of code i used was indeed from a private server donno wich one anymore. but yes i used that due the fact i didnt understand the trim and split of text.

still im trying to figure out your peace of code and im not quite sure how its returnd. butt i will figure that out.[/quote]

Learning from private server code is the worst thing you can possible do.

Read full topic
